docs.snippet: LONDON May 3 The International Planned Parenthood Federation said here today that, after drawing together the available evidence, it had found that the risks involved in the use of oral contraception were small and its continued use throughout the...
docs.lead_paragraph: LONDON May 3 The International Planned Parenthood Federation said here today that, after drawing together the available evidence, it had found that the risks involved in the use of oral contraception were small and its continued use throughout the world was "fully justified."
docs.abstract: Internatl Planned Parenthood Fed issues rept declaring risks involved in use of oral contraceptives are small and that their continued use is fully justified; says possible risks must be weighed against benefits and advises caution in certain cases; details cases; says no evidence has been uncovered linking adverse effects on health of children born to mothers who discontinued oral contraceptive use

headline.main: USE OF BIRTH PILLS CALLED JUSTIFIED; Planned Parenthood Group Reports Risks Are Small

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, May 9 (Reuters) Nine LatinAmerican countries with 200mile territorial water limits have issued a declaration upholding all countries' rights to establish their own sea limits and control their coasts' natural resources.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, May 9 (Reuters) Nine LatinAmerican countries with 200mile territorial water limits have issued a declaration upholding all countries' rights to establish their own sea limits and control their coasts' natural resources.
docs.abstract: Govt signs statement, with 8 other Latin-Amer countries that have 200-mi territorial water limits, upholding all countries' rights to establish their own sea limits and control natural resources of their coasts

docs.snippet: Felipe Herrera, president of the Inter-American Development Bank, declared yesterday that the bank would like to issue more bonds in the United States to expand lending in Latin America, but that it was unable to do so because of high interest rates.
docs.lead_paragraph: Felipe Herrera, president of the Inter-American Development Bank, declared yesterday that the bank would like to issue more bonds in the United States to expand lending in Latin America, but that it was unable to do so because of high interest rates.
docs.abstract: Inter-Amer Development Bank pres Herrera says bank would like to issue more bonds in US to expand lending in Latin Amer but is prevented by high interest rates, s, US C of C meeting, says decisions made by bank at recent meeting in Uruguay are expected to enable bank to increase lending by about 50% over last yr, comments on bank's financing, int
